alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 9:24AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Scotland and west central Clark Counties through 1000 AM CDT... At 923 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rutledge, or near Memphis, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... South Gorin around 930 AM CDT. Wyaconda and Granger around 940 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Luray. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
